mdRecord.dcterms:title: To my loved one: Air--Annie Lisle / By E. Walter Lowe, 19th N.Y. Cavalry
Dearest, do you still remember
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lowe, E. Walter (Ebenezer Walter), 1830 or 1832-1919
Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in 5 verses, each consisting of an 8-line followed by a 4-line section; without music. Printed in blue (verses 1-4 in 2 columns above the 5th verse, printed as 1 column) on illustrated letter paper; verso of sheet ruled in blue. Embossed stamp at lower left.
First line: Dearest, do you still remember.
Advertisement: 500 Illustrated Balleds, lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York. Branch Office: No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C.
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint appear to have been published in 1863 and 1864.
Hand-colored headpiece featuring a couple within a floral bower at upper left corner, the whole enclosed in a single rule border. Magnus 247b. Cf. American song sheets, 2350b.
Library Company of Philadelphia, American song sheets, 2350b.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Twenty-second of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
